On May 1, 2005, at 2:09 PM, apolloimperium wrote:

> I'm currently working on a peice of fiction set back in the time
> period right before Oda Nobunaga rose to power.  I need direction
> towards sites that focus on the raising of a young male in the samurai
> caste, probably for a son of a hatamoto, as well as a site defining
> the structure of the samurai caste.  The other thing that I am trying
> to work out, I've seen references to both Shinto and Buddhism being
> practiced by samurai, but nothing clearly stating which was prefered
> and the time periods they were prefered in.
>
> The only other thing I was looking for, I've seen lots of pictures of
> castle cities, however I am having a hard time finding a blueprint
> type deal - A layout, etc.
>
> Any help anyone can give I would appreciate it!
>
> Apollo

If you're serious about the topic of (military) power and religion in 
Japan the 16th century, the crucial text is Neil McMullin's BUDDHISM 
AND THE STATE IN SIXTEENTH-CENTURY JAPAN.
This is actually a book that I would suggest to anybody. Is very 
informative and well written - half of it is about Nobunaga.
